intro: Jacquemontia ovata, commonly known as the showy yellow jimsonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are hairy and often branched. It grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Jacquemontia ovata is part of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
